p: Vaccines are antigenic preparations used for the induction or enhancement of a pre-existing immunity of animals and humans to prevent or cure a disease or to promote the control of its transmission. They are the best cost-effective tools for controlling infectious diseases, and recently, their use has been extended with success to the immunotherapy of cancer based on unleashing immune checkpoints. Vaccines and sanitation were the two largest contributions to public health in the last two centuries. They both contributed to reducing the morbidity and mortality of infectious diseases ( 1, 2).
